{{disambig-two|the character in ''[[The New Shadow]]''|[[Wise-woman]] of the [[Edain]]|[[Saelon (daughter of Malach)]]}} {{infobox character | people=[[Gondorians|Gondorian]] | name=Saelon | image=Gregor Roffalski - Saelon.jpg | caption="Saelon" by [[:Category:Images by Gregor Roffalski|Gregor Roffalski]] | pronun= | othernames= | titles= | position= | location=[[Gondor]] | affiliation= | language=[[Westron]] | birth=Early [[Fourth Age]] | birthlocation= | rule= | death= | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | house= | parentage=[[Duilin (father of Saelon)|Duilin]] | siblings= | spouse= | children= | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Saelon''' was one of the main characters in ''[[The New Shadow]]'', the abandoned sequel to ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''. == History == Saelon was caught by [[Borlas]] as a child when he was stealing an apple in Borlas' garden. Borlas' anger and description of Saelon's behaviour as doing ''orc's work'' struck in to Saelon's heart - he felt deeply aggrieved and held this as a deep grudge. Some years later, Borlas and Saelon sat in the garden across from [[Minas Tirith]]. After Borlas described the [[Dark Tree]], it is Saelon who later mentions that there were men who have grown ''under the shadow'' in recent times and whispered the name [[Herumor (The New Shadow)|Herumor]], the possible leader of a rebellious faction in Gondor, to Borlas.{{PM|Shadow}} == Etymology == The name ''Saelon'' is in [[Sindarin]], however its meaning is unclear. According to [[Paul Strack]], the name might contain the element ''[[sael]]'' ("wise") and ''[[on]]'' ("masculine suffix").{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-3087798997.html|articlename=S.
